item.title: I Can’t Stop Noticing Eye Floaters
item.description:
You blink, and there it is.
You move your eyes — still there.
You try to focus — and now it’s all you can see.

If you’ve said to yourself,

“I can’t stop noticing eye floaters,”
You are not alone — and you’re not broken.

This post is for anyone who feels like they’re trapped inside their own vision.

Why You Keep Noticing Them (and Why It’s Not Your Fault)

Here’s the hard truth:
The more you look for floaters, the more your brain learns to find them.

item.title: How to Explain Floaters to Someone Who Doesn’t Get It
item.description:
You try to explain what’s bothering you.
You say something like:

“There’s this thing in my vision. Like a shadow, or speck, that follows me…”

And the other person shrugs.

“Sounds annoying. But it’s probably nothing, right?”

You feel dismissed. Misunderstood.
And maybe even a little crazy for caring so much.

If you’ve ever asked, “How do I explain floaters to someone who doesn’t get it?”, this post is for you.

item.title: Floaters Are Ruining My Focus — What Can I Do?
item.description:
You sit down to write. Or code. Or work.
And boom — your attention fractures.

“There it is again… that damn floater.”

You blink. You shift your gaze. You try to ignore it.
But now your brain is chasing it, trying to track it, trying to fix it.

Your focus? Gone.

If you’re thinking “Floaters are ruining my focus — what can I do?”, this post is for you.
